ratings.comment: Lots of reading for discussion and it is necessary because it is how you write your papers. The lectures are interesting and fun, but not mandatory and while the majority of exams cover the lecture material, it is discussed a bit in discussion. I would recommend going to lecture anyways because they are interesting.

Heavy on reading with a couple big papers. A lot of the paper work is done in discussion. Can be boring at times but lectures aren't usually too dry and she is a wonderful lecturer who adds spice and humor to each class. Loves what she does and has great TAs working with her.

Karma is an amazing woman! I didn't particularly like the topic of the class, but she was always there to help and was very responsive to emails. I recommend taking any class with her and going to her office hours just to chat. She works on a lot of cool things at UW and has a lot of knowledge to share.

Karma is the coolest and she knows a lot about this subject. Lectures were made interesting by her explanations and connections to life that were relatable. Grading really depends on your TA, but Karma does give clear assignment instructions in the syllabus. Not too hard of a class, just be ready for four 500-word papers and regular reading.

Karma is Awesome. class is super interesting. 4 500 word papers, 1 is 1500. 2 tests including final. TA's grade papers very hard, seems like no matter how good it is you get a low B on papers. TA's "don't give out A's" ... always want you to strive for better. Despite this, super interesting class, learned a lot. Try to get meg as a TA, not Jaiwen.

Karma is a nice lady and knows what she's talking about. She grades very harsh on papers and assigns many. Exams are completely memorization, be ready to memorize every term from every lecture. Lecture is optional, but the slides posted online do not have most of the information you need in order to do well on exams.

It's because of her that I declared a major in Comm Arts. She makes the class super interesting, and she's a really funny person. There are a lot of readings, but they're not bad. 4 papers, and the tests are pretty easy if you go to class.

Karma is a fantastic instructor! I really enjoyed the class. It's not a ton of class, but its not easy either. Her lectures are engaging and probably one of my most favorite classes here on campus this semester. Theres not a moment in her lectures when I feel bored.  Take the class! You do have to study hard for the tests, but its not too bad.

Very interesting class. Dr. Chavez is a great lecturer and specific examples are on the 1 exam. It's no secret she's a liberal (it's Madison, after all) but she does consciously try to present both sides as having valid points (and this is coming from a conservative). TAs are super helpful and Dr. Chavez is very available during office hours.

The papers were graded very stringently by the TA's. Although lecture is not necessary, to get a good grade on the test one will need specific examples used in lecture on specific days. I recommend going to all of them and writing down the examples. Just skim the readings and keep up with the study guide through the semester.

AWESOME lecturer. Her lectures are interesting to go to and well crafted. You will feel engaged the whole time. This class is a lot of writing but you will get so much out of it. Not necessarily an easy A, but her and the TA's will always be available for help. Great class to take, highly recommended.

Karma is an superb professor.  She cares about a lot of an important issues and has a way of spreading her passion among her students.  She is very friendly, funny and respectful towards everyone and truly creates an inclusive learning environment.  She is brilliant, yet humble and never puts herself above her students.

Karma is incredible. Very knowledgeable in her field, takes the time to explain tough concepts, gives constructive feedback on assignments. If you put in the work in her class, you will learn more from her than all of your other professors combined.

Course reader is irrelevant, don't get it. Only one exam, not that bad. 3 papers are tough but the feedback is good and curve the grade down. I don't know why people think all the feminism and LGBTQ stuff is shoved down our throats because we rarely talked about it. Good class

Professor Chavez is an amazing professor. She does a wonderful job at explaining the text and working with the student to find meaning and learn materials. She is a great pedagogue and provide a comfortable space for learning. I would recommend everyone take a class with this remarkable professor.

This class is not going to be what you expect it to be. Wayyy more complicated and harder than you can ever imagine. Two exams (hard af) related to lectures and the extensive readings and three papers (tediously graded) It's hard to get even a C and you'll most likely want to drop it once you get your first exam score back.
This class is nothing like I thought it would be. If you plan on taking this class be prepared to have LBGQT and feminist views endlessly pressed upon you. It's ridiculous.

This class is nothing like you think it would be. Lectures are confusing and not related to the readings at all. You can't get clarification in discussion because what you do in there is not related to the course at all. Readings are impossible and exams are very difficult

Dr. Chavez is a REALLY cool person! She's chill, but presents a lot of interesting points in class. Also, it's clear that she's a feminist. THE CLASS: Harder than you think. TA's are cool, but are surprisingly hard graders. B/C averages hard. Come prepared to READ THE ARTICLES, have essays proofread extensively, and GET NOTES IN LECTURE!!! NO CURVE
She is a very passionate teacher. Lectures are interesting, and important for the tests. She has opinions, but loves hearing from a different side. She is super nice and her class was a lot of fun.

This class was not what I thought it would be. Readings are EXTREMELY tedious and useless. Don't do them- just go to class. That is all you need. Be prepared to have leftist and feminist views shoved down your throat. But hey, it is Madison...

This class - the Theory and Practice of Argumentation and Debate - was completely different than I (and many of my classmates) expected. Instead of improving our argumentative skills, Karma spent most of the semester trying to incorporate her political beliefs into our class materials and ended up teaching  us her version of feminism 101 not CA262.
